welcome.title: Welcome
elevator_speech: Hello! My name is Nikita. I am a future software engineer currently studying computer science at one of the most reputed French engineering schools, the ENSEEIHT. I'm trying to specialize in software development and especially the car industry, which is one of the reasons why I'm currently working as an apprentice android developer for Ampere Software Technology.

As you could have guessed by now, this is my e-portfolio website. Here you can find some of the most important information about my current studies or the projects I'm working on. Besides that, you can also find some more personal facts about me, especially the stuff I do outside of school/work (sports, civic engagement, people that inspire me).

iut.title: IUT de Saint-Malo
iut.description: I've started my journey in the IT sphere by obtaining a bachelor's degree in Networks & Telecommunications at the IUT of Saint-Malo, in France. During these two years I've gained solid knowledge in several domains of IT,such as networking, telecommunications and programming. All while studying at the university, I was also "working"as a network technician apprentice at the departamental council of Finistère (29), a precious experience that allowedme to consolidate the basics that I've obtained at the IUT by working on real projects.
iut.projects_intro: Talking about projects, here as some of them, realized both at university and at "work".

projects.title: Network automation tool
projects.description: For my final IUT project, I had to create a network automation tool for my company (dpt. Council of Finistère). The goal was to create a powerful yet ease-to-use software that any technician could quickly get to grips with. Based on Python and Ansible, this tool can generate network configurations and directly apply them on hundreds of equipments (a task that formerly requested considerable amounts of time and was a big source of errors).

projects.title: Graduation ceremony website
projects.description: Another big project that I had the opportunity to work on was the creation of a website for the graduation ceremony of the Network & Telecommunications department. This website provided future graduates all the important information about the ceremony and also gave them to opportunity to get their places, directly on the website. I mainly participated in the front-end development, while my group worked on the back-end.

projects.title: WEI Website
projects.description: One of some less significant projects of mine was the creation of another website for my university. Each year, the BDE (Student Leadership Office) organizes a so called "week-end of integration" for the new students. My goal in this project was to design and create the website, providing potential participants with every bit of information they could need.

enseeiht.title: ENSEEIHT
enseeiht.description: At the current stage of my carreer I am a first-year computer science engineer student at the ENSEEIHT (École nationale supérieure d'électrotechnique, d'électronique, d'informatique, d'hydraulique et des télécommunications). I'm also an apprentice android developper for a branch of Renault Group, Ampere Software Technology. At the ENSEEIHT, I primarly study computer science, programming, mathematics and soft skills. On the other hand, my apprenticeship allows me to put in work the things I learn at school, mostly by developping on-board applications for Renault Group's cars and then testing them on these same cars. Sounds cool, doesn't it?
enseeiht.projects_intro: Here are some of my current projects that are both personal and professionnal.

projects.title: Alpine Telemetrics
projects.description: Alpine Telemetrics is my current project at Ampere. It is an on-board application for the new series of Alpine cars that allows their drivers to gather some live information about their car, such as G-force, lap time, brake or tyres temperatures and many more. It was concepted as a mini video-game inside of your car that allows you to enhance your track performance, especially by completing some challenges or following built-in coaching tutorials.

projects.title: Rennes Immobilier
projects.description: This is one of the biggest projects I have had the opportunity to work on, at this stage of my career. Rennes Immobilier is an Airbnb-like website that I'm currently working on with one of my friends from the IUT. While he's working on the back-end, I'm in charge of the UI/UX of Rennes Immobilier's website, as well as the front-end development itself.

coming_soon.title: Coming soon...
coming_soon.description: Well... this section's name is pretty self-explanotary, isn't it? For the moment I cannot tell you (neither can I tell it to myself) what route my career will take after graduating from the ENSEEIHT. All I can say for now is that I like what I'm doing and I'd like to pursue in this field of IT for some part of my life after my graduation. But keep in mind that I am a very manual person, so there is a considerable possibility that in 10 years from now you would rather find me opening a garage than opening a tech start-up. Time will show everything!
